Title: Pakistan LNG revises 72-cargo tender based on supplier feedback
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has revised the terms of its tender to buy 72 cargoes of LNG for delivery between 2023 and 2028 based on supplier feedback and extended the deadline for offer submissions to Oct. 3 from Sep. 14. Offers are expected to be valid until Oct. 20.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand's PTT eyes more long-term LNG contracts amid soaring spot prices, market volatility
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT expects to increase the proportion of LNG it buys on a long-term basis as the current gas price and supply crisis facing buyers has driven it to focus on ensuring supply security. And an escalation in LNG prices to all-time high levels this year and severe market volatility has made it challenging to secure cargoes on a spot basis.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom’s production and exports fell by 49.1 bn m3 in January-August
Description: Russia’s state-controlled Gazprom decreased its production of gas and its gas exports to countries outside of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) by the same volume in the first eight months of the year, compared to the same period last year. Its non-CIS markets include countries in the European Union, its largest export market, Turkey and China, among others
Author: DE

Title: Eni will replace half of Italy's Russian gas imports this winter, all of it by 2025
Description: Italy’s Eni expects to replace 50% of Italy’s demand for Russian gas with gas and LNG from its own portfolio this winter, and it sees this proportion rising to 80% next winter and to 100% in 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Italy pushes for gas price cap ahead of EU energy ministers’ meeting this week
Description: Italy will push for a ceiling on soaring gas prices during an extraordinary meeting of the European Union’s energy ministers this week, following the latest cut in Russia’s pipeline gas supplies to the bloc.
Author: CK
